Articles.Content:
I have abandoned this mod for the foreseeable future. If I do continue it, it will likely be largely started from scratch. It does not work in 1.3 right now. If you are a modder and want to make an unofficial RevSSS Continued, then please do it only through ModuleManager configuration (i.e., please don't redistribute this mod).

 

Revamped Stock Solar System is a mod that takes the stock Kerbol system and makes it look quite a bit cooler. It also changes some of the physical properties of the planets. The end result is a system that looks cooler and acts more like a realistic star system. It is more similar to the Real Life Solar System in some respects, and more "Alien" or "Kerbal" in other respects.

v0.6

[Album Link, because Album Embedding is Broken]

Other Albums:

Spoiler

v0.2: http://imgur.com/a/iQoLz

Laythe Biomes: http://imgur.com/a/PVfEN

v0.3: http://imgur.com/a/eheQ5

v0.4: http://imgur.com/a/UDNok

v0.4.5: http://imgur.com/a/Izxuz

v0.5.1 Pic: http://i.imgur.com/BMXYjKt.png

LIST OF CHANGES

  • All Planets with atmospheres have been given more realistic atmospheres.
  • Sun made brighter and has been made a 1/10 scale replica of the real world Sun. It is no longer ludicrously gigantic for a star of its mass. It is now a proper G-type yellow star.
  • Eve's violent violet color has been reduced to a dull lavender and brown, with purple-blue atmosphere rims.
  • Gilly has been totally remade. Gone is the simple lump-ball derived from a height noise. Gilly is now given an appearance more reminiscent of Phobos and Deimos, the moons of Mars.
  • Kerbin has slightly brighter atmosphere rims.
  • Mun has been moved out to an orbit which more closely resembles the orbit of Earth's moon. It has been given more procedural craters of varying sizes, and a single tycho-like crater with bright white ejecta. It is darker and browner as a whole.
  • Minmus has moved into an even further out orbit to facilitate the moving of the Mun. It is darker, dirtier, and greener now, with some varied procedural craters.
  • Duna has been totally overhauled. It now uses a heightmap and terrain derived from its pre-0.21 appearance, before it was given a botched half-done revamp.
  • Ike's color map has been repurposed as its heightmap, with a few major modifications. This results in a recognizable, but less lumpy body.
  • There's a new moon around Duna, the tiny asteroid Rimos, orbiting outside of Ike's orbit.
  • Dres has not  been physically changed at all. It's fine as it is, actually.
  • Jool's cloud map has been redone from scratch with a more green/yellow/white color scheme.
  • A new moon, Kev, has been added as the innermost moonlet. It's an uneven grey lump, and according to mythology, it's Ameli's best friend.
  • A new moon, Ameli, has been added into the position of Regular Moonlet. It's an uneven red lump much like Amalthea.
  • Bop has been moved into a high inclination, low semi-major-axis irregular moon orbit. It has also been made darker and given craters.
  • Laythe is now like a planet-wide Yellowstone National Park. It's full of interesting geology and hot springs, as well as active volcanoes. It's also been shrunk slightly.
  • Vall has been completely overhauled. It's been given cracked craters and a more varied surface. It's also been shrunk slightly.
  • Tylo has been given a new color scheme that resembles Iapetus. It's also got plenty of craters. It's now larger than Kerbin but a bit less massive, due to a majority icy composition. 
  • Pol has been moved further away from Jool to become an Irregular Moonlet. It's in a retrograde orbit, and is more irregularly shaped.
  • A new moon, Gobe, has been added as a new Irregular Moonlet in an inclined prograde orbit. It's a small rubble pile of irregular shape, heavily cratered. Similar to the Saturnian moon Hyperion.
  • Eeloo is now brown and off-white. Imagine if Pluto and Europa had a baby.
  • Eeloo now has a little white blob of a moon, Mix.
  • Jool, Vall, Ike, Duna, and Laythe all have new biome maps.
  • Optional patches to revert size and orbit changes to the Jool system, as well as a whole host of optional orbit patches for Minmus. All of these are toggleable in a settings.cfg file.
  • Basic OPM compatibility (resolves the Outer Planets Mod conflict).
  • Principia Compatibility Patches.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is this compatible with Environmental Visual Enhancements/Scatterer?
A: Yes, thanks to Cetera's wonderful mod Revamped Kerbol Atmospheres. It is important to note that this is not a part of Revamped Stock Solar System, but an add-on mod that goes with it. Bug reports on Scatterer and E.V.E. compatibility should go to his thread.

Q: Does this actually change planet terrains or is it just a texturepack? Can I actually go and land in those new dry riverbeds on Duna?
A: This mod actually does change the surfaces of planets. This is really more of a planet pack which happens to be modifying the stock planets. So yes, you can rover all around the new surface of these worlds. I especially like flying a plane around the Hot Springs of Laythe.

Q: Is this any harder than the stock system?
A: No. In fact, for the Joolean moons, it may even be easy. RevSS is meant to set the stage for future rescale mods, including 10x scale.

Q: Shouldn't Tylo have an atmosphere?
A: Yes, it should. But it won't, for several reasons.

Q: How to install?
A: See the "Install Instructions" just below the download link.

Q: Is there a Delta V map?
A: No, but if you create one I will gladly link it here in the thread.

Q: Hey, do I recognize Ameli from somewhere?
A: Nope, not at all. Definitely not. It does not exist anywhere else, certainly not in Kuzzter's Kerbfleet comics and in Alternis Kerbol Rekerjiggered. Definitely not.

Q: Will you release standalone versions of these planets?
A: No, but you can remove the individual configs that change the individual planets. You can find the old Jool revamp here, though.

Q: Where can I find older versions (0.3 and previous)?
A: You can find it on the old GitHub Repository.

Q: Why did you change the name of the mod/Why did you make a new GitHub repository?
A: Relevant xkcd.

Q: How much memory does this use up?
A: Not sure. I do not use DDS textures or Kopernicus' Load On Demand right now, but that is a planned feature.

Q: Will this screw with my save file?
A: Probably. You shouldn't use this on an already existing game, or change back to stock after making a save. (Unless you enable all of the stock orbit/size features, then it should be fine.)

 

DOWNLOAD version 0.6 for KSP 1.2.X at GitHub

Install Instructions:

  1. MAKE SURE to delete old versions of RevSS from GameData before installing a new version.
  2. Download and Install the Kopernicus plugin version 1.2.0-1 or higher.
  3. Install ModuleManager, if you don't already have it. It's pretty common though, so you probably do have it.
  4. Install Revamped Stock Solar System. Put the folder RevampedStockSystem into GameData.
  5. Congratulations! You should have installed Revamped Stock Solar System. Have fun!

 

CREDITS

@GregroxMun for creating the mod.

@KillAshley for the terrain materials tiling config from KASE, as well as feedback, support, and help.

@Sigma88 for feedback, support, help, and exporting some of the textures to DDS.

@Thomas for maintaining the Kopernicus plugin. Also for feedback, support, and help.

@NovaSilisko for feedback, and making the original Stock System which is (obviously) the basis for this mod, as well as the original idea (design document, if you will) for this mod. The mod has since diverged significantly from this original concept of course.

@eggrobin for helping me better understand what makes an orbit stable, and for the Principia plugin which helped me actually test RevSS's stability.

@OhioBob for making the RealisticAtmospheres mod, and the custom atmosphere curves for Laythe, Moho, and Jool.

Edited December 24, 2017 by GregroxMun
abandonment message
It looks really shiny! Onto my "weekend try" list it goes!

Wow, this looks amazing. Might be just what I need to get started with KSP again even before 1.1 hits us.

 

Question on procedural stuff: do I get it right that the craters will be recreated for each save and persisted?

Edited March 17, 2016 by LordFjord

1 hour ago, LordFjord said:

Wow, this looks amazing. Might be just what I need to get started with KSP again even before 1.1 hits us.

 

Question on procedural stuff: do I get it right that the craters will be recreated for each save and persisted?

Craters are, just like for the Mun, identical per planet for every single save file in any installation of the game. The craters will never change their relative positions to the rest of the planet. Procedural generation of craters doesn't mean it is new each time, it just means it is generated each time. It's not defined by a heightmap. In this way, many of KSP's planets have quite a bit of noise on them. Minmus, Pol, and Gilly are entirely procedural, with the latter being just a height noise.
Absolutely beautiful!
Looks very promising...  I wonder,  how hard it would be to add rescaling support (x2 ; x6.4)?

On 3/18/2016 at 4:21 AM, evileye.x said:

Looks very promising...  I wonder,  how hard it would be to add rescaling support (x2 ; x6.4)? 

Check out Sigma-Dimensions? It probably could do it now. (Disclaimer: I have no idea if it could do it now.)

4 hours ago, komodo said:

Check out Sigma-Dimensions? It probably could do it now. (Disclaimer: I have no idea if it could do it now.)

Sigma Dimensions can definitely rescale RevSS. However, I do eventually plan to make a spinoff pack for sizes ranging from 6x to 10x scale to make the system Realism Overhaul type material. It would be pretty cool to use real world technology to launch from Earth-sized Kerbin to a landing on Laythe.

Realistic Kerbol System would have all the changes of Revamped Stock System, plus:

  • Resized to 10 times stock. (and resizable with Sigma Dimensions to 6.4x stock or any other size)
  • Most planets given rekerjiggered terrain, either through extra/modified noise, VertexPlanet, or even remade heightmaps.
  • Remade atmosphere characteristics to be more reasonable.
  • Asteroid moon bodies given either 10 times lower gravity or 10 times higher terrain deformity, depending on the body.

Looks interesting, I enjoy mods like this, but a few ideas for you...

-Reduce the amount of craters on Ike, too much in general

-Why does Eeloo look like pizza? Not really a fan of it

-A Callisto analogue, a carbon moon hard to spot

Just a few ideas from myself, feel free to take action or not.

4 minutes ago, AlexTheNotSoGreat said:

Looks interesting, I enjoy mods like this, but a few ideas for you...

-Reduce the amount of craters on Ike, too much in general

-Why does Eeloo look like pizza? Not really a fan of it

-A Callisto analogue, a carbon moon hard to spot

Just a few ideas from myself, feel free to take action or not.

1: It's an airless body that is pretty old. It's going to have a lot of craters.

2: Because it's like Pluto and Europa had a baby. If Pluto's color scheme is pizzalike, then so must Eeloo's.

3: I've considered it.
Cool looking. Any chance of a moon with a moon? I've always wanted Tylo with - say - Bop orbiting it.

1 minute ago, 5thHorseman said:

Cool looking. Any chance of a moon with a moon? I've always wanted Tylo with - say - Bop orbiting it.

Maybe if I ever add a second gas planet. I don't want to change the stock system that much.
Duna: Looking Way Cooler Now
Ike Revamp Mk2, coming right up!
What about that new oblate planet Nova wanted to add?

Just now, _Augustus_ said:

What about that new oblate planet Nova wanted to add?

No.

1 minute ago, GregroxMun said:

No.

Why?

Just now, _Augustus_ said:

Why?

Atmospheres can not be made oblate. That said, Dres will be oblate and rapidly spinning. It doesn't have an atmosphere though, so that's fine.
Tylo revamp Mk2
Looks nice, Gregrox!
Can you add an option to make standalone versions of the new bodies?
Gilly's looking pretty good!
Looks awesome! I hope it's compatible with Harder Solar System!

1 hour ago, legoclone09 said:

Looks awesome! I hope it's compatible with Harder Solar System!

It is not likely to be compatible with Harder Solar System, because the orbits of some of the moons have been changed.

7 hours ago, GregroxMun said:

It is not likely to be compatible with Harder Solar System, because the orbits of some of the moons have been changed.
